conclusion: Introduction to the optics problem involving a semi-cylindrical glass brick.
Description of the semi-circular cross-section of the glass brick and the setup of the problem.
Interpretation of the given distances between points A and B as either arc length or chord length.
Calculation of arc length and chord length for the given distances.
Decision to proceed with the interpretation of the arc length as the more exact value.
Placement of the semi-circle in the coordinate plane and determination of the equation of the semi-circle.
Determination of the positions of points A and B based on the angle from the vertical.
Application of Snell's law at point A to find the angle of refraction.
Determination of the direction of the refracted ray inside the glass.
Application of Snell's law at point B and analysis of the symmetry of the path.
Use of symmetry and geometry to hypothesize the placement of points A and B.
Calculation of the angle of incidence and application of Snell's law at point A.
Analysis of the symmetry and emergent ray condition at point B.
Calculation of the refractive index using the angle and Snell's law.
Final estimation of the refractive index of the glass using the distance 0.26R as the arc length.
